'It looks as though you have strayed a little ways from home, [placeholder], and you want to learn about scholarship?

'It seems, then, that you have come to the right place.

'You want to speak with Makan here in the Craft Hall. He will be able to set you upon the path of scholarship.'

<rgb=#FF0000>WARNING: You must make sure to have room in your inventory for this quest.</rgb>

'Scholarship, is it? A fine choice for any self-respecting dwarf!

'Studying the past and learning its secrets can be a very rewarding profession. Of course, there are some dangers involved with finding those secrets in the first place, but with a healthy sense of adventure, anything is possible.

'Go and see Makan, here in the Craft Hall. He will set you on the path to becoming another in a long litany of fine scholars.'

'You are far from home, [placeholder]. We will honour your request and help you as you learn the art of scholarship.

'Thavroniel, here in the Crafting Terrace, is an apprentice in the profession of scholarship. If you are looking for guidance, I am certain that she will be willing to assist you with the fundamentals of the craft.'

<rgb=#FF0000>WARNING: You must make sure to have room in your inventory for this quest.</rgb>

'The study of the past is a pursuit that provides us with insight into our elders and the ways that they chose.

'I have asked one of our promising novices to watch over and guide any new scholars towards learning the very basics of the profession. Her name is Thavroniel, and she stands near the workbench here at the Terrace.

'Speak with her, and she will teach you the very basics as she progresses in her own studies.'

'You will find Hildibras Took near the workbench here in the Crafting Area.

'He is knowledgeable in the art of scholarship and is awaiting the arrival of new would-be scholars.

'Speak with him if you are interested in learning and practicing the scholarship profession.'

<rgb=#FF0000>WARNING: You must make sure to have room in your inventory for this quest.</rgb>
You have made a scroll of minor scholar lore

'Scholarly pursuits are wondrous. Every curiosity that we find must come with a story, and learning that story can help to make us all wiser.\n\n'You will want to speak with Hildibras Took here in the Crafting Area. He has volunteered his time and energy to teach all of the new apprentices. Mind him well.'
You have made a Scroll of Minor Scholar Lore!

'Well, look at you. I do not often see your folk here, and when I do, I always find it a bit queer. Well, hobbits less so because of the hill.

'Oh, I am sorry, you wish to know more of scholarship? It just so happens that there is a fine scholar in this very hall, still learning, but taking to the art very quickly. Her name is Anna Bullrush, and you will find her by the workbench in the larger room.

'Good day, [placeholder].'

<rgb=#FF0000>WARNING: You must make sure to have room in your inventory for this quest.</rgb>

'Scholarship is a goal worth pursuing, and there are many fine scholars here in Combe.'

She smiles brightly.

'I have secured the time and teaching of Anna Bullrush, a novice scholar, but a fine student who is quickly refining her art, to teach all those who are looking to set out as scholars.

'She can be found here in the Craft Hall of Combe.'

'Hullo, there. I hear that you are interested in learning the ways of scholar. If so, you have come to the right place.

'I will try to not move too quickly for you, but if I do, speak with me again to ask more pointed questions.

'I almost forgot the most important thing for every new scholar -- ingredients. Everything you need to make a scroll of minor scholar lore is inside this <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb>.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>Scholar vendors sell ingredients and recipes that are a vital part of any Scholar's training and continued work.</rgb>

Scholars study the ancient and not-so-ancient past to divine the secrets that were kept there. They can craft many wondrous treasures by learning of the past that can result in potions, oils, and scrolls which can enhance you and your fellows.

<rgb=#FF00FF00>Be careful! You will need to complete the correct recipes and deliver the correct items outlined in this quest.

You will need to execute the minor scholar lore recipe and deliver the minor scholar lore scroll. Failing to do so will force you to obtain new raw materials or to restart the quest after a 24-hour delay.</rgb>
Speak with the novice scholar in the crafting area
You have been provided with ingredients
Open the <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> given to you by the novice scholar to collect the aged scrap of text and early Third Age relic
You now have all the ingredients to make a scroll of minor scholar lore
Using the ingredients you received, craft a <rgb=#FF00FF00>scroll of minor scholar lore</rgb>
Bring the <rgb=#FF00FF00>scroll of minor scholar lore</rgb> to the novice scholar
#-1:[placeholder]Bring the <rgb=#FF00FF00>Scroll of Minor Scholar Lore</rgb> to #-1:{Hildibras[O]|Thavroniel[L]|TBD[D]|Anna}

'Do you have the scroll of minor scholar lore? I do not see it. I hope you did not tear it in frustration or sell it for coin. I would like to inspect your work. You had best find a way to make another.'
You should speak with the novice scholar to learn more about scholarship.

The novice scholar provided you with a <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> full of ingredients that you can use to execute the scroll of minor scholar lore recipe. Open the <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> to get the ingredients.\n\n<rgb=#FF00FF00>Ingredients for Scholars are normally purchased from vendors found near ruins, inside chests, or sometimes upon sentient enemies. You can also find ingredients on the Auction Hall.</rgb>
The novice scholar provided you with the ingredients necessary to create a scroll of minor scholar lore.
The recipe is complete. <rgb=#FF00FF00>Do not sell the scroll of minor scholar lore!</rgb> It is time to show your handiwork to your mentor, the novice scholar.

'If you are looking for guidance in scholarship, then I am prepared to offer you direction.

'If my methods are too fast, feel free to speak to me again, and I will answer any questions that you may have. I will do my best to provide you with clear direction. The first and most important step is having the proper ingredients.

'I have kept some of these ingredients aside for purpose of providing to new scholars. Take this <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> and let us begin.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>Scholar vendors sell ingredients and recipes that are a vital part of any Scholar's training and continued work.</rgb>
'You should speak with the scholar trainer at once!'

'Well, look here... another would-be scholar. I am pleased to meet you and looking forward to helping you get started.

'If I go too fast or you need help at any point, you can ask me questions about scholarship, and I will do my best to provide you with clear direction. The first and most important step is having the proper ingredients.

'I set aside a few for new scholars like yourself. Take this <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> and let us begin.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>Scholar vendors sell ingredients and recipes that are a vital part of any Scholar's training and continued work.</rgb>
'You should speak with the scholar trainer at once!'

'Hello, there. I hear that you are interested in learning the ways of a scholar. If so, you have come to the right place.

'I will try to not move too quickly for you, but if I do, speak with me again to ask more pointed questions.

'I almost forgot the most important thing for every new scholar -- ingredients. Everything you need to make a scroll of minor scholar lore is inside this <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb>.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>Scholar vendors sell ingredients and recipes that are a vital part of any Scholar's training and continued work.</rgb>
'You should speak with the scholar trainer at once!'

'Let me see what you were able to do....'

He inspects the scroll with a discerning eye.

'No misspellings, and it seems that this will provide you with a fair amount of focused insight.

'I think that you have done very, very well, [placeholder]. I approve and declare you a novice scholar.'
'You should speak with the scholar trainer at once!'
'Oh no, did you sell your scroll of minor scholar lore? Well, I need to inspect one, so you had better find a way to make me another.'

'Grab your <rgb=#FF00FF00>scholar's tools</rgb> and make sure you have them equipped, then open the <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> of ingredients that I gave you and begin your studies.'\n\n<rgb=#FF00FF00>Ingredients for Scholars are normally purchased from vendors, found near ruins, in chests, or sometimes on sentient enemies. You can also find ingredients on the Auction Hall.</rgb>

'Let us see what you have gone and made.'

He inhales deeply and begins reviewing the scroll.

'I see nothing wrong with the information that you have written on this page. I think that it will provide a good deal of focus for your studies.

'You pass, [placeholder]. You are on your way towards becoming a master scholar!'

'Making the scroll of minor scholar lore should be simple. Use your scholar's tools to study the items that I provided you and scribe the knowledge that you glean to craft the scroll.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>To open your crafting panel, you can use the T key or click on the crafting button (it looks like a hammer and anvil) in the lower left part of your UI.

Select the Scholarship tab in the craft UI and find the proper recipe.

Scholarship requires no facilities in early tiers, but will require a study for more advanced recipes.</rgb>
'I hope you did not tear up the scroll in anger or sell it for some meagre coin. Well... I cannot pass you without seeing your handiwork. Back to the workbench with you!'

'You must scribe a scroll of minor scholar lore. To do this, equip your scholar's tools and study the items that were within the crate I provided you.'

You can also find ingredients on the Auction Hall.</rgb>

'May I see the scroll you penned?'

She takes a moment to admire your handiwork.

'Your script is elegant, and there is nothing wrong with this scroll. You are well on your way towards becoming a scholar. Well done, [placeholder].'

'To make the scroll of minor scholar lore, you will need to open the <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> of ingredients that I provided to you. Equip your <rgb=#FF00FF00>scholar's tools</rgb> and begin your studies.'\n\n<rgb=#FF00FF00>Ingredients for Scholars are normally purchased from vendors, found near ruins, inside chests, or sometimes upon sentient enemies. You can also find ingredients on the Auction Hall.</rgb>

'It should not be that difficult to craft the scroll of minor scholar lore. Equip your scholar's tools and study the items that I provided you, then scribe the insight that you gain to make the scroll.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>To open your crafting panel, you can use the T key or click on the crafting button (it looks like a hammer and anvil) in the lower left part of your UI.

Select the Scholarship tab in the craft UI and find the proper recipe.

Scholarship requires no facilities in early tiers, but will require a study for more advanced recipes.</rgb>
'Have you forgotten something? Do you not have the scroll of minor scholar lore that you were to deliver to me? You should return with one.'
Introduction to Scholarship

'Scribing the scroll of minor scholar lore should be easy. Study the items that I gave you and scribe the knowledge that you glean onto a scroll.'

'Let me see what you have done.'

She looks over the scroll.

'I can find no fault with the information that you have scribed on this page.

'I think that this is a very good effort and proves that you are prepared to continue your work towards becoming a master scholar.'
